entity55.name: antibiotic-resistant bacteria
entity55.description: Bacteria that have developed resistance to antibiotics, making them difficult to treat with conventional medications.

entity56.name: global public health
entity56.description: The overall health of the population on a global scale, encompassing efforts to improve health and prevent disease worldwide.

entity57.name: antibiotic resistance
entity57.description: A phenomenon where bacteria evolve mechanisms to withstand the effects of antibiotics designed to kill or inhibit them.

entity58.name: antibiotic use
entity58.description: The administration of antibiotic medications to treat bacterial infections, which should be done prudently to avoid resistance.

entity59.name: stewardship programs
entity59.description: Programs designed to optimize the treatment of infections while reducing adverse events and the emergence of antibiotic resistance.

entity60.name: novel antimicrobial agents
entity60.description: Newly developed drugs or therapies aimed at effectively treating bacterial infections, particularly those caused by resistant strains.

entity61.name: resistant strains of bacteria
entity61.description: Bacterial populations that have developed resistance to one or more antibiotics, making them difficult to treat with conventional therapies.
